column1: #text=This past weekend I rode a public bus .
#text=I was in a busy city and needed to get to a tour bus .
#text=After getting of the train system I was directed to the city bus .
#text=I noticed a section of the block where a lot of people were standing around and the bus would stop in this area to put up passengers .
#text=There was but after bus after bus and you had to move fast .
#text=I was told that number 77 was my bus .
#text=So when I saw it pull up I had to push through the crowd so that I could board my bus .
#text=I was able to get on and the bus captain came over to me after a minute or so and collected my fair .
#text=As I sat back to relaxed I noticed that the bus driver was driving the bus with wild abandon .
#text=He was flying through the street and than squealing the brakes as he tried to keep control of the vehicle .
#text=I just knew we were all going to die .
#text=I was trying to get my friends attention but she was turned around and deep in a conversation .

#text=This was a nerve racking situation not only because of his driving but I did n't really know my stop so I was tried to calm my heart as we nearly missed car after car and look our the window to determine where the tour bus company was located .
#text=It finally worked out because a few of the passengers was going to same place and directed me to get off at the right location .
#text=They were so nice and I was able to speak with a few of them .
#text=So , I guess I can say it was n't all bad because I made a friend or two with some of the passengers and I made it to my tour bus location in plenty of time for my trip home .
